column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers

column.name: SOC
column.comment: Service order code, which is used to calculate the amount belonging to the characteristic.

column.name: TARGET_TARIFF
column.comment: This attribute defines Tariff/Tariff_Option. Whenever the SOC has the same rate definitions for all Tariffs/Tariff Options the field is populated with the default value.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: The effective Date of the Email Validation - The Access Information is effective dated.

column.name: FEATURE_CODE
column.comment: This field contains the feature code

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: OC_INFO_IND
column.comment: This attribute defines whether or not there is a rate for One-time Charges (OCs) for this feature. It is used to indicate to the process whether one-time charges are linked to the rated feature it is handling.

column.name: UC_INFO_IND
column.comment: This attribute defines whether or not there is a Usage Charge (UC) rate for this feature. It is used to indicate to the process whether any  usage charges are linked to the rated feature it is handling.

column.name: RC_INFO_IND
column.comment: This attribute defines whether there is a recurring charges rate for this rated feature.

column.name: AC_INFO_IND
column.comment: This attribute defines whether there is an additional charge rate for this rated feature.

column.name: RC_FREQ_OF_PYM
column.comment: This attribute indicates the interval (in months) between the recurring charges payments.

column.name: RC_USG_DEPEND_CODE
column.comment: This attribute defines the recurring charge method, flat or tiered, according to the usage or the number of subscribers (possibly subscribers of a specific Product). · F - Flat · T - Tiered

column.name: RC_TIER_TYPE
column.comment: This attribute determines the measurement of tier units for the recurring charge. The level can be subscriber number, subscriber longevity or Usage (minutes or DM

column.name: RC_RATE_QTY_TYPE
column.comment: This attribute indicates if the recurring charge is defined by percent or by DM

column.name: RC_SUSP_QTY_TYPE
column.comment: This attribute indicates if the suspension recurring charge is defined by percent or by DM

column.name: RC_ADV_ARREAR_CODE
column.comment: This attribute indicates whether the recurring charge payment is paid in advance or in arrears.  D - Advanced  R - Arrears

column.name: RC_CHARGE_LVL_CODE
column.comment: This attribute defines the charge level, i.e., it defines whether the recurring charges for this rated feature are for each subscriber or for the entire BAN.  B - BAN  C - subscriber

column.name: RC_RATE_LVL
column.comment: This attribute defines the recurring rating level, i.e., BAN or subscriber. When the level is BAN, the rate value is defined according to the number of subscribers the BAN has. If this field is defined as BAN level and the Charge Level field is defined as

column.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
column.comment: Expiry Date

column.name: FR_FM_PLAN_CD
column.comment: The participant's Friends-and-Family code, if it is a conversation about a corresponding number. Otherwise the field is not filled.
